title: Klobuchar hits Sanders on health care
text:
Languishing in national polls, Sen. Amy Klobuchar has been looking for a standout moment in the debates, and tonight, she came armed with a line going after Sen. Bernie Sanders on proposal for Medicare-for-all.

In July, Sanders clapped back at critics of his health-care proposal, saying “I wrote the damn bill.” Tonight Klobuchar echoed the line, saying it would take away private insurance for millions of Americans.

“While Bernie wrote the bill. I read the bill, and on page eight of the bill, it says that we will no longer have private insurance as we know it,” Klobuchar said. “I don’t think that’s a bold idea. I think it’s a bad idea.”

She argued for an expansion of President Barack Obama’s health-care law, arguing it would bring down costs and expand coverage. “That is a bold idea,” she said.
